content: I think I'll use the first one: "Remember, your dreams are within reach, and I'll be cheering you on every step of the way." It's short, sweet, and conveys my support and encouragement for Emma's future. Now, I just need to start writing the letter and make sure it's perfect for Emma. Do you have any tips on how to make the letter look more special, like using a certain type of paper or adding any embellishments?
